content:
Hello all,
Hope all is well. We have legacy sql server database with MVC application as front end . we would like to expose FHIR API on top of sql to third party solutions. Could you please share any reference implementation project or references available . it would be much appreciated.

Can I connect to sql server database and get data using FHIR API same as web api in .NET ?

Thanks

Or open source facade
https://github.com/brianpos/fhir-net-web-api/tree/develop-r4/src/Hl7.Fhir.DemoFileSystemServer
Which is available as NuGet package
https://www.nuget.org/packages/brianpos.Fhir.R4.WebApi.AspNetCore/3.7.0-beta1
You just need to implement the models which you hook to your storage layer, and the facade does all the controller/fhir interactions.

just need to implement the models

easy peasy!
You know, the mapping of your internal/sql model to the fhir model. No biggie :wink:

Thank you so much for the information. MVC application will continue use the traditional way of getting the data from legacy sql. so other topic is to expose FHIR RESTful API to HIS to consume via FHIR RESTful API. Thanks @Michele Mottini commercial product serve the purpose. We are looking for open source as the scope is to consume for pilot phase.

@Brian Postlethwaite - sorry, can we expose FHIR REST API with NuGet Package?
we have finished the mapping for sql model to FHIR.

Thanks
Check the sample code, yes that's what it's for.

Hi all, sorry to re-open the topic. Can you please help me here?

Does this open source facade supports the below topics?

  1. Authentication with OAuth2 and OpenIdConnect
  2. Support for https and Single-Sign-on environments

Thanks

Thanks @Brian Postlethwaite do we have any reference implementation /documentation for above options(Oauth and OpenIDconnect, SSO).
much appreciated.
Thanks

Just regular dotnet webapi stuff.
I've personally used identityserver to help implement it.
